topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53db8d1d636872228fc60000#post_53db8d1d636872228fc60000
It's important cause it means we're making strides towards actual scifi like cybernetics.

The reason why it's been so slow in a nutshell was for ages the electrical impulses ran the risk of damaging muscle tissue.  This is good news cause we're not close to being able to hook up body tissue to electrical circuitry without causing severe damage.

To use a analogy the reason why we haven't had cyborg parts that connect to your tissue to move or give touch is that think of like your nervous system as a computer plug; if you have a computer from Europe plugging it into a american socket would fry it.  We now have a electrical converter so one of the biggest hurtles from us having actual cyborgs has been cleared.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

I'm a sub really. And the fact that I'm just 17 and is planning to finish college before anything 'happens'. Besides, who'd wanna do a cyclops anyway. Only ever had one girlfriend whom I still think about from time to time.

The "I never asked for this" route.

Actually when you think about it that was the entire story of Deus Ex: Human Revolution in a nutshell was that the electrical-tissue connections had a problem of decaying due to the electrical impulses and that the conflict was brought about due to a breakthrough in strong making strong connections that didn't break down resulting in societal change that special interest groups didn't like.
